posts.post_content: For a man that defeated Nicol Bolas, the card is quite lacking. Though many legendaries back then were, but still. Posted By: lo0k1tzsteve (3/7/2010 8:30:21 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: What do you mean "lacking"? It's a 3/3 for 3, which already makes him better than most of the creatures in the early sets, and his ability is better than that of [Royal Assassin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Royal Assassin). My only complaint is that you can't cast [Shielding Plax](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shielding Plax) on him, but at least he's immune to [Terror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terror).
posts.html:

Posted By: TPmanW (1/9/2011 9:58:33 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @TPmanW: actually, his abilities make sense flavorwise. He was the Imperial champion of the Madaran Empire, so if anyone put up a fight, represented by blocking or tapped, he would come in and respectfully kick their asses until they gave in or died. His second ability references his feud with [Ramses Overdark](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ramses Overdark), who has the ability to kill a creature who is enchanted. since he is unable to be enchanted, he wins, just like he did in the story. I am not quite sure how [Bolas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bolas) fits into the card though, maybe he managed to tap him when the body was destroyed by the hammer? Anyway, I hope that clears the flavor issues up a little.
posts.html:
@TPmanW: actually, his abilities make sense flavorwise. He was the Imperial champion of the Madaran Empire, so if anyone put up a fight, represented by blocking or tapped, he would come in and respectfully kick their asses until they gave in or died. His second ability references his feud with Ramses Overdark, who has the ability to kill a creature who is enchanted. since he is unable to be enchanted, he wins, just like he did in the story. I am not quite sure how Bolas fits into the card though, maybe he managed to tap him when the body was destroyed by the hammer? Anyway, I hope that clears the flavor issues up a little.

Posted By: Tzaph (5/21/2012 3:17:24 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
"Long ago in a distant land, I, Nicol Bolas, the Elder Dragon Master of Darkness, unleashed an unspeakable evil! But a foolish Samurai warrior wielding a magic sword stepped forth to oppose me. Before the final blow was struck, I tore open a portal in time and flung him into the future, where my evil is law! Now the fool seeks to return to the past, and undo the future that is Bolas!"  
  
  
Come on Wizards. Do another Samurai block. Kamigawa doesn't count because there were too many ninjas, and not enough Scotsmen, mob gangsters, robot assassins, and most importantly, not enough GREAT FLAMING EYEBROWS!!!!
posts.html:
